name: NewYorker
text: Despite an onslaught of confirmed COVID-19 cases in mid-March, Iceland never imposed a lockdown. And yet, by mid-May, the virus had virtually been eliminated in the country. How did they do it? https://t.co/GtJuPMeHQo

text: “We are never ﬁnished with grief. It is part of the fabric of living,” V. S. Naipaul writes. “Love makes memories and life precious; the grief that comes to us is proportionate to that love and is inescapable.”  https://t.co/xw7YUQ6yt0
